result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon A. Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Includes domestic abuse and DNA surcharges.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathon A. Walker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnathon A. Walker appeared in court. 
District Attorney John Snider : Present. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters guilty plea. 
Per DA Snider, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 
Court orders defendant to 30 days jail, imposed/stayed, probation 1 year. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs, including DOMAB 
- pay supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.

Assistant District Attorney James Fassbender: Present
Defendant: Nonappearance
